title: Disillusionment
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Freedom in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"When \u003cspan\u003eDisillusionment\u003c/span\u003e Sets In","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13383,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89417,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Feeling \u003cspan\u003eLet Down\u003c/span\u003e in Your Marriage","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Disillusionment is a sign that things aren’t working. You start to recognize that the person you married isn’t who you expected them to be and the life you have created isn’t the one you want anymore.\r\n\u0026nbsp;\r\nEarly on, this is the stage where there is still a possibility of reconciliation. If you openly communicate and find a way back to each other, you may be able to find new common ground that works for you both. As you move through the divorce process, you may find that disillusionment grows. Your partner’s behaviors and attitude towards divorce and life after continue to change, sometimes in surprising ways.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

excerpt: “Something is not right. How did everything go so off track?”

meta.title: Feeling let down:
meta.card_text: Many people experience ongoing frustration, pent-up resentment, or a loss of trust in this first phase. All this can show up as frequent arguments, a sense of emotional distance in the relationship, or a feeling that one’s needs aren’t being met. It’s a tough place to be, and many ask themselves if their marriage will ever get better.
meta._yoast_wpseo_metadesc: Disillusioned or just not happy. Understand the disillusionment stage of divorce with resources to help you manage expectations and emotions.
meta._yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: Disillusioned or just not happy. Understand the disillusionment stage of divorce with resources to help you manage expectations and emotions.
meta._yoast_wpseo_twitter-description: Disillusioned or just not happy. Understand the disillusionment stage of divorce with resources to help you manage expectations and emotions.

title: Dissatisfaction
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Dissatisfaction in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"\u003cspan\u003eExpressing\u003c/span\u003e Your Unhappiness","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13388,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89418,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Growing Sense of a \u003cspan\u003eMismatch\u003c/span\u003e","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Dissatisfaction is marked by the open expression of unhappiness by one or both partners. This happens as the feelings of a mismatch grow stronger, which can lead to arguments and blame.\r\n\r\nDuring this phase, partners who are dedicated to saving the relationship will communicate openly and honestly, and may seek the support of counseling. They will also act with empathy as they work towards a common understanding of each other’s needs. Partners who are moving toward divorce may find themselves withdrawing, arguing more, and finding fault in each other when they can’t resolve their issues.\r\n\r\n\u003cem\u003eCommon emotions during this stage: guilt, anger, fear, grief.\u003c/em\u003e","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

excerpt: “It’s time to talk about the problem. It’s worth giving it one last shot.”

meta.title: Talking it out:
meta.card_text: During this stage, it’s all about talking it out. Once any issues and unhappiness are out in the open, exploring counseling might seem like a lifeline for the relationship. This is a time for many honest conversations and efforts to reconnect. Couples can work with a counselor to better understand each other, address underlying problems, and see if the marriage can be repaired. It's a time of hope mixed with uncertainty.
meta._yoast_wpseo_metadesc: Feeling unsatisfied in your marriage? Explore the dissatisfaction stage of divorce with insights on coping and understanding your feelings.
meta._yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: Feeling unsatisfied in your marriage? Explore the dissatisfaction stage of divorce with insights on coping and understanding your feelings.
meta._yoast_wpseo_twitter-description: Feeling unsatisfied in your marriage? Explore the dissatisfaction stage of divorce with insights on coping and understanding your feelings.

title: Decision
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Decision in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"Charting \u003cbr\u003e Your \u003cspan\u003eCourse\u003c/span\u003e","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13398,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89419,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Moving \u003cspan\u003eForward\u003c/span\u003e ","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"The decision phase is a turning point. Deciding to divorce is difficult, and deciding to stay may not be easy. Some couples take time apart to try life without each other. Others worry about what will happen to their children, assets, or friends.\r\n\r\nFor couples moving forward with divorce, the decision is about making a firm choice and recognizing that there’s likely no going back. This begins a shift in identity for individuals and the family, and can bring on a deep sense of loss. For couples who decide to stay, both parties must truly commit to the marriage and put in the work. If divorce looms overhead, success is unlikely.\r\n\r\n\u003cem\u003eCommon emotions during this stage: anger, guilt, fear, grief.\u003c/em\u003e","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

We can introduce you to the best family lawyers in your area.","_location_text":"field_connect_with_lawyer_location_text","image":13306,"_image":"field_connect_with_lawyer_image","spacing_top":"normal","_spacing_top":"field_connect_with_lawyer_spacing_top","spacing_bottom":"normal","_spacing_bottom":"field_connect_with_lawyer_spacing_bottom","bg-color-class":"bg-seashell","_bg-color-class":"field_connect_with_lawyer_bg-color-class","content_wrapper":"medium","_content_wrapper":"field_connect_with_lawyer_content_wrapper"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->
excerpt: “It’s decided and there’s no going back now. The anxiety is sky-high.”

meta.title: Reaching a turning point:
meta.card_text: This stage is when people decide to file for divorce. It can be nerve-wracking, especially when realizing there's no going back. This phase is filled with anxiety about the future and the big changes ahead. People might worry about how it will affect their children, finances, and social life. It's a period of deep reflection and tough choices.
meta._yoast_wpseo_metadesc: Learn about the decision stage of divorce and how to approach this pivotal point with clarity and support from DivorceLawyer.com
meta._yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: Learn about the decision stage of divorce and how to approach this pivotal point with clarity and support from DivorceLawyer.com
meta._yoast_wpseo_twitter-description: Learn about the decision stage of divorce and how to approach this pivotal point with clarity and support from DivorceLawyer.com

title: Action
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Action in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"Go with \u003cspan\u003eConfidence\u003c/span\u003e","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13397,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89420,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Moving Through the \u003cspan\u003eDivorce Process\u003c/span\u003e","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Once the decision to divorce is made, the practicalities set in. Action is the stage where paperwork is filed and things start moving forward. You’ll want to find a good lawyer who can represent your interests.\r\n\r\nAs you pursue divorce, you’ll start making progress toward things like separating assets and physical space, determining child custody, telling friends and family, and taking on all that your new identity encompasses. This can feel daunting, and having a strong support system in place can help.\r\n\r\n\u003cem\u003eCommon emotions during this stage: anger, grief, fear, guilt, relief, hope.\u003c/em\u003e","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

excerpt: “The lawyers are on it. Everyone needs to know, especially the kids.”

meta.title: Taking legal steps:
meta.card_text: This is when legal action takes place. It usually involves emotional and physical separation, telling family and friends, and figuring out what's best for the kids. This is also when assets are divided, custody arrangements are made, and a move to a new home may be involved. It’s a busy, often stressful time, but also a step towards closure.
meta._yoast_wpseo_metadesc: Time to take action. Explore and understand this divorce stage with resources that guide you through the legal and emotional process.
meta._yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: Time to take action. Explore and understand this divorce stage with resources that guide you through the legal and emotional process.
meta._yoast_wpseo_twitter-description: Time to take action. Explore and understand this divorce stage with resources that guide you through the legal and emotional process.

title: Acceptance
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Acceptance in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"Closer to \u003cspan\u003eClosure\u003c/span\u003e","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13396,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89421,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Learning to Love the \u003cspan\u003eNew\u003c/span\u003e You","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Acceptance is all about finding your new self as you move through the world as a divorcee and newly single person. It is a process in and of itself that may come quickly for some, and take years for others. Be gentle with yourself during this time as you realize that your married life was not fulfilling and that there is still life ahead. If you have children, they will need your help embracing that they are loved and that the divorce was not their fault. They might feel a loss of security, and their behaviors may communicate feelings that they cannot fully express with words.\r\n\r\nYou might also be surprised by your behaviors, thoughts, and actions as you explore the world through a new lens. This is common and comes from the big changes happening in your life. There will be ups and downs, but recognizing that a new future awaits is key.\r\n\r\n\u003cem\u003eCommon emotions during this phase: grief, fear, relief, hope\u003c/em\u003e","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

We can introduce you to the best family lawyers in your area.","_location_text":"field_connect_with_lawyer_location_text","image":13306,"_image":"field_connect_with_lawyer_image","spacing_top":"normal","_spacing_top":"field_connect_with_lawyer_spacing_top","spacing_bottom":"normal","_spacing_bottom":"field_connect_with_lawyer_spacing_bottom","bg-color-class":"bg-seashell","_bg-color-class":"field_connect_with_lawyer_bg-color-class","content_wrapper":"medium","_content_wrapper":"field_connect_with_lawyer_content_wrapper"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->
excerpt: “Frankly, it had all been falling apart. It really was time to go separate ways.”

meta.title: Coming to terms:
meta.card_text: This is a stage of many emotional, mental, and physical adjustments. People begin to accept that the marriage wasn’t working and start looking forward to the future, wanting to build a new, single identity and make fresh plans. This can include taking on new hobbies, creating a new social circle, or focusing on personal growth. It’s all about healing and people finding themselves again.
meta._yoast_wpseo_metadesc: Find acceptance during divorce with supportive resources to help you move forward with peace and understanding.
meta._yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: Find acceptance during divorce with supportive resources to help you move forward with peace and understanding.
meta._yoast_wpseo_twitter-description: Find acceptance during divorce with supportive resources to help you move forward with peace and understanding.

title: Freedom
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Freedom in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"Go Your\u003cbr\u003e  \u003cspan\u003eOwn Way\u003c/span\u003e","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13395,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89422,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"The Path \u003cspan\u003eAhead\u003c/span\u003e","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"The chapter after divorce is about starting over. In the shift from being married to single, you will likely experience a sense of freedom along the way. How you experience this will depend on many things, like how long you held on to a marriage that wasn’t working and your financial picture.\r\n\r\nFor some, the moment you finally utter, “I want a divorce,” brings freedom and relief. For others, you might be wondering what this newly found freedom means – will I need to go back to work? How will I manage parenting on my own? Will I keep the same friends? Where will I celebrate the holidays? Freedom can be thrilling and terrifying all at once. One thing is certain – your life is yours alone to shape.\r\n\r\n\u003cem\u003eCommon emotions during this phase: relief, hope, fear\u003c/em\u003e","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

excerpt: “There’s a whole future ahead! This sense of freedom is unbeatable.”

meta.title: Embracing a new life:
meta.card_text: Finally, those who’ve gone through a divorce start enjoying their new independence. They welcome opportunities for personal growth and change, looking forward to a life of freedom. Many go on travels, pursue new career opportunities, or simply enjoy the peace of living on their own terms. It’s a time of newfound confidence and excitement about new possibilities.
